programs.name: Build A Human Powered Vehicle
programs.description: Based on the Victorian Curriculum's Cross-curriculum Priority: Learning about Sustainability, these hands-on STEM lessons guide secondary students through a systems engineering approach that takes into account the aerodynamic and eco-friendly aspects of their HPV.

programs.name: Aerodynamics Workshop
programs.description: In the Aerodynamics Workshop, students learn how airflow impacts speed and efficiency by designing and testing their own aerodynamic models in a mini wind tunnel. They experiment with different shapes, gaining insights into how engineers use aerodynamics to create faster, more efficient vehicles.

programs.name: Rider Development Workshop
programs.description: The Rider Development Workshop introduces students to the science behind human-powered racing, teaching them how to maximise energy output and optimise race strategies through gear changes and racing line techniques. Especially ideal for schools with trikes, this workshop has a wide range of available options depending on the knowledge, year level and time length available to the students.
